thread.title: Palmer dismisses notion of Cardinals taking winless Lions for granted
thread.title_full: Palmer dismisses notion of Cardinals taking winless Lions for granted

title: Palmer dismisses notion of Cardinals taking winless Lions for granted
text:
Palmer dismisses notion of Cardinals taking winless Lions for granted FOX Sports 
Oct 8, 2015 at 12:53a ET + Matt Kartozian / USA TODAY Sports FOX Sports Updated Oct 8, 2015 at 8:29a ET 
Carson Palmer dismissed the notion that the Arizona Cardinals might overlook the winless Detroit Lions on Sunday. 
“We’re not taking this game for granted whatsoever. This is a good football team," said Palmer, using Detroit's latest defeat as an example. "This is a team that was a foot and a half away from beating Seattle at home." true Palmer on the Lions "This is a team that was a foot and a half away from beating Seattle at home." 2/2 #AZvsDET — Mike Jurecki (@mikejurecki) October 7, 2015 
There's also the matter of the Cardinals attempting to rebound from their first loss, a 24-22 setback against the St. Louis Rams in which they dominated play for much of the game. 
“You never want to lose, but it’s a challenge coming back,” Palmer said. “It’s a tough environment and we’re going to see what we’re made of.” 
Since Bruce Arians was named coach, Arizona has lost back-to-back games only once with Palmer in the lineup - both coming in a five-day span against division rivals San Francisco and Seattle in October 2013. MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our NFL newsletters.
